titlestmt.titleproper: J. Howard Woolmer Bloomsbury Workshop and Charleston Farmhouse collection 1982-2000
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: J. Howard Woolmer Bloomsbury Workshop and Charleston Farmhouse collection
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: J. Howard Woolmer was born in Montreal in 1929. He moved to New York City in 1958, where he began a career as a professional bookseller in the early 1960s. In addition to working at his business, J. Howard Woolmer has compiled a number of published bibliographies and collections of note, including A Checklist of the Hogarth Press 1917-1946, and a catalogue as well as a bibliography of Malcolm Lowry's writings. In recent years Mr. Woolmer has built collections relating to American poets, Irish poets, American Jewish writers and Irish theater for the Firestone Library at Princeton University. The Bloomsbury Workshop is the international specialist for work by the Bloomsbury Group. The Charleston Trust is a charity set up in 1980 to restore and maintain the home of the Bloomsbury Group for the benefit of the public.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of materials related to the Bloomsbury Workshop and the Charleston Farmhouse Trust gathered by J. Howard Woolmer. Materials include: programs, brochures, flyers, and correspondence.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
